## Functions

### getLevel() {#a6f32c8cbe9e69d7926b20fcf456281b7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt; CodeGenOptLevel &gt; llvm::CodeGenOpt::getLevel (int OL)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Get the <code>Level</code> identified by the integer <code>OL</code>.

Returns std::nullopt if <code>OL</code> is invalid.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/codegen-h/#l00065">65</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/codegen-h">CodeGen.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### parseLevel() {#acc31ff64de59cc3caccf959912140759}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt; CodeGenOptLevel &gt; llvm::CodeGenOpt::parseLevel (char C)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Parse <code>C</code> as a single digit integer and get matching <code>CodeGenLevel</code>.

Returns std::nullopt if the input is not a valid optimization level.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/codegen-h/#l00073">73</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/codegen-h">CodeGen.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
